dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (In Arabic) Hey, did your cousin finally end up getting married?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (In Arabic) Yep, she's married, she doesn't live here anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richard, anxious, questions Anwar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did he say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gives you his blessing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sheik and the moukadem turn and exit the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chieko is sitting in the reception area, waiting her turn There is a woman with a twelve year-old son listening to walkman and an old couple.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The receptionist (50) will not stop talking to the old la

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My niece sells these creams. And just look at my skin now. I'm going to turn fifty-two and look, almost no wrinkles...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The woman continues her banal chatter. Chieko observes he grotesque mouth. She then looks at the old man's bored fa the old woman's feigned interest, the mother's annoyed expression, and the boy, who rocks his head to the music.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A man walks out and the receptionist gestures at Chieko a points toward the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dentist (47) - tall and, unlike the receptionist, wit impeccable skin covering his hardened, attractive face - examines Chieko's mouth. His face comes very close to her as he looks at her, making her nervous. The fat reception walks in without knocking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here are the sterilized drill bits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dentist looks up at her. She leaves the drill bits on table and leaves. The dentist turns back to Chieko and sp face to face with her so she can read his lips.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I-think-you-have-two-cavities-in- your-molars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She smiles. The dentist moves closer to Chieko's mouth ag she cannot stop looking at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, Chieko licks his cheek. He is surprised, but continues his checkup. She licks him again, this time on lips. He pulls away, flustered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She grabs his hand, puts it on her inner thigh and rubs i against her pubis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He, confused, tries to pull his hand away, but she preven him from doing so. The scene starts to turn slightly grotesque. After a slight struggle, he pulls his hand bac

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the matter with you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She grabs his hand again and, again, pulls it toward her pubis. He gets angry and moves back. The fat woman enters again without knocking, sees they are agitated and, witho a word, walks out and closes the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dentist turns toward Chieko.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She shakes her head. She is excited, anxious, scared, fragile. He pulls her by her wrist out of the chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get out right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He walks to the door and opens it. Just before she walks out, Chieko draws out a slight smile, which is almost a g

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chieko walks down crowded Tokyo streets.   She walks with lost gaze, unsettled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chieko arrives at an upper class apartment complex. The architecture is cutting edge, but impersonal and cold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chieko enters the lobby. Beside the doorman are two men dressed in suits: Kenji (31) and Hamano (50). The janitor gestures at Chieko with his chin. The men walk over towar her and cut her off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you Yasujiro Wataya's daughter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chieko doesn't manage to read his lips. She is silent. Th doorman notices the situation, walks out from behind his small desk and shouts at the men.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's deaf mute. Face her when you speak so she can read your lips.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kenji and Hamano are disconcerted. Hamano stands squarely in front of her and speaks slowly, emphasizing every word

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are-you-Yasujiro-Wataya's-daughter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We-are-sargeants-Kenji-Mamiya-and- Hamano-Kanoo-of-the-Tokyo-police. We-need-to-find-your-father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She pulls out a pen and a piece of paper from her bag. scrawls a few lines and hands them over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hamano reads it and turns his face toward hers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, he didn't do anything wrong. We just want to talk to him. Do you know where he is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She shrugs her shoulders. Kenji gives her his card. Upon receiving it, Chieko turns to look at him. Their eyes mee and she looks down. She then looks up again, blushing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell him to call us. And don't be scared, we're not going to do anything bad to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chieko can't stop staring at Kenji. The two cops leave. soon as they do, Chieko heads toward the elevator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chieko walks into the apartment. It is a large apartment, elegantly furnished. Although decoration is scant, some hunting trophies stand out: a scimitar-horned Oryx, sheep and others. There are also photographs of Yasujiro huntin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A wall is dedicated to family photos. Among them is a pic of Chieko as a little girl with her father and her mother

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chieko sees a note on the table at the entrance. She puts the policeman's card down and picks up a note from her fa that says: "I waited until five and you didn't make it. I've got a meeting and I'll be back late. I left you some soup and some chicken for dinner. Kisses. Papa."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chieko sits in front of a mute T.V., channel surfing.   S stops at a fashion show, then some cartoons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, on a news program, we see the photographs of Ah and Yussef. Chieko looks at them for a moment and then changes the channel. She is watching T.V. when a red bulb set between a yellow bulb and a blue one, starts to light insistently as the doorbell rings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chieko notices and shuts off the T.V.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chieko opens the door and Mitsu walks in. They greet each other with a handshake where they end up touching their i fingers to each other's hearts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you ready?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I'm just going to get my bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chieko goes to get her bag. Mitsu sees the policeman's ca on the entrance table and looks at it. Chieko comes back and Mitsu asks her about it in sign language.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cops came again?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. They hadn't come in nine months. But these were different cops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did they come to ask about your mothers' death?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, but they're probably going to ask my dad about the same things.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're just not convinced, are they?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chieko shakes her head, remains pensive and then smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Believe it or not, I liked one of the cops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chieko puts Kenji's card in her purse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you put on some panties?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chieko smiles, lifts up her skirt and exposes her naked p Mitsu lifts hers up as well and is also without panties. They laugh and leave the apartment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dawn. The desert is a rose plain softly lit by the sun's first rays. Yussef and Ahmed are digging a hole with thei bare hands. Once they're finished, they clean up around t hole and mark it with three stones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alarid (40), a federal cop, tall, in an impeccable unifor with numerous rank badges, stands on the highway examinin the site of the shot with the old man who was driving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the distance we can see a police checkpoint stopping s cars and, after checking them, letting them go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (To the old man, the entire dialogue in Arabic) Are you sure it was here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure. I drive down this road every day. The American tried to stop me right here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stands more or less where Richard tried to stop him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was scared. He was covered in blood and I was coming from picking up my grandson from his work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where was the bus?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The old man points some twenty yards behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Over there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alarid walks toward where the old man said and looks out the mountains. Some of his men are visible at the tops. Alarid talks to them by radio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look further to the right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can see some men exploring the terrain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (To the old man) Why did you wait so long to contact the police?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had to drive my grandson home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The radio crackles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain Alarid, Captain Alarid... We found the cartridges.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alarid squats, scrutinizing the four empty cartridges lyi on the earth. One of his men approaches and Alarid signal with his hand for him to stop immediately.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop right there...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The man remains motionless. Alarid follows the prints tha lead away from the cartridges. He reaches the mess of goa hoof-prints. He picks up a ball of shit and feels it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're from around here. Find out who has a .270 caliber rifle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yussef and Ahmed walk back home, lost in their own though Suddenly a jackal trots out and stares at them. Yussef pi up a rock and throws it. The jackal runs off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hassan and his wife are listening to the radio and playin cards at a table placed outside the house. As they play, Hassan whittles a stake with a small knife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hassan's wife lowers her hand and Hassan follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I won...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His wife pushes two chips from her pile toward him. In th distance, several trucks approach, kicking up a dust clou Hassan's wife gets up to better see them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you expecting anyone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hassan stands up and watches the vehicles come closer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Five trucks pull up in a semicircle around the house. A dozen police officers get out armed and aim at Hassan and his wife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alarid gets out and stands next to his car door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hassan Ibrahim?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hassan paralyzed by fear, answers in a broken voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of the police officers approaches him aiming directly his head, while another one aims at his wife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drop your weapon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hassan lifts up his knife and shows it to them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not a weapon, it's my knife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drop it, now...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hassan drops the knife in the dust.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get down on the floor... face down...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hassan and his wife look at each other before they obey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did we do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cop readies himself to fire, and Hassan drops to the ground. His wife follows and also lies on her stomach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abdullah takes two goats out of the corral, ties a rope t their neck and drags them over to a rock. The goats bleat desperately trying to break free.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abdullah turns to look at his children.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yussef and Ahmed hold their legs.   Abdullah pulls out a and slits the goat's throat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hassan lies on the floor, cuffed, with a broken mouth, surrounded by cops. Alarid is carrying out the interrogat squatting next to Hassan's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why did you shoot at the bus?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't shoot at anyone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then who, you idiot?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hassan remains silent and turns to look at his wife who i sitting on a chair, cuffed, a few yards away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It wasn't me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alarid punches him in the face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was your rifle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, not anymore, I sold it today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah?   To who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abdullah gives Yussef and Ahmed some goat skins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take these goat skins to Naguib and see if he wants to buy them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two brothers bundle up the skins, tie them up with so cord and they leave down the path away from the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they climb a hill, they encounter a convoy of Moroccan police trucks. They are terrified. The vehicles screech t a dramatic halt before them, lifting up much dust.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alarid opens the passenger window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, do you know where Abdullah Adboum lives?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ahmed and Yussef exchange a glance.   Yussef nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ahmed gets very nervous.   Yussef points the wrong way wi an air of certainty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Over there, you have to cross those mountains.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They told us he lived around here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, we just live here with our mother. Abdullah lives over there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alarid scrutinizes the brothers' faces.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you're lying to me I'm going to come back and cut your balls off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ahmed breathes nervously.    Yussef continues in cold blo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can come back whenever you like.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alarid smiles and gestures at the driver with his head th they should go on. The police vehicles drive off in the direction Yussef pointed them in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ahmed and Yussef run home. Their mother and sisters are milking some goats into a tin bucket. When they fill, Abd empties the milk out into a barrel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Papa... papa...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abdullah puts the bucket down on the floor and turns to l at his kids, who stop before him, panting, exhilarated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ahmed can barely control his gasping.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The police... they're looking for you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me?    Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, they're not looking for you... they're looking for us...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You?    Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because of what happened to the tourist...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yasira and her two daughters stop milking and approach. Abdullah can't seem to understand what their talking abou

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What tourist?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The American... Yussef killed her...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not true, we both did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you saying?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ahmed fires his words out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yussef started shooting at the cars because Hassan said that the bullet could go really far...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a lie, you started shooting at the cars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, but you killed her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abdullah loses his patience and grabs Ahmed by the should

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ahmed looks at his father straight in the eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yussef killed the American and he spies on Zora naked and Zora lets him watch her...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abdullah turns toward Zora.   In his mind, everything is confusion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is your brother talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's bullshit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not bullshit; she's a whore and my brother spies on her...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As soon as the words leave Ahmed's mouth, Yussef decks hi and leaves him sprawled on the dust.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ahmed shoots right back up and runs at Yussef kicking, un they're both entangled in the fight and end up rolling on the ground. Abdullah tries to get between them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Debbie and Mike are almost like spectators at a soccer ma between the other kids, as they play in the dirt with an orange plastic ball.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody passes to them.    Mike just runs from side to sid without saying a word.    Frustrated, Debbie just watches

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: nside the house, Amelia is checking on the food.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (All in Spanish) How many pots of rice did you make?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I made two.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amelia looks out the window and sees the vast amount of g that have arrived and which have transformed the hamlet i a large parking lot of trucks, horses, carts, etc.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too many people have come, that's not going to be enough. Make two more pots.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns to another of her daughters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you Maria Eugenia, warm up more tortillas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She sees Santiago walk past the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Santiago... please go kill another six chickens, or there won't be enough food.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Santiago stops and looks through the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Out back, Santiago sees a car arrive.    A priest steps o

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luis is standing under a shack drinking beer with some friends. Amelia, worried, approaches him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Both in Spanish) Luis, the priest is here and Patricia hasn't arrived. Where is she?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fifteen minutes left before the wedding and you have no idea?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if she doesn't want to get married? Shut up and come help me look for her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Santiago arrives at where the children are playing.   He out to them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (In Spanish) Who wants to help me with the chickens?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone raises their hand and go toward him. Mike and De stand still without knowing what to do. Santiago calls th

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike and Debbie. Come with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The chickens walk around a rustic chicken coop made with wire mesh and mesquite posts. Santiago opens the door to the coop and lets the kids in, Mike and Debbie among them Once inside, Santiago tells them to catch the chickens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (In Spanish) I'll give ten pesos to the first one of you who catches a chicken.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The kids start chasing the chickens, which scamper as soo as they feel hands trying to grab them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At first, Mike and Debbie don't know what to do, but they are soon amused and run to catch them. After a while, Deb catches one and holds it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Santiago applauds her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Debbie is the winner. Now we need another five.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The kids get back to their game of catching chickens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Santiago's car drives down the road, with a terrible sun beating down on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luis drives while Amelia looks out the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Both in Spanish) Did you get into a fight with Patricia?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, not at all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't bust my hump to pay for this wedding for Patricia not to show. So she's either coming or she's coming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Santiago has several chickens tied up. One of the kids catches the last one and hands it to Santiago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (In Spanish) Ready. Now who's going to help me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Several children raise their hands. Mike and Debbie raise theirs as well, excited. Santiago picks Mike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's see, Mike, you can help me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Proud, Mike walks toward Santiago and stands next to him. Santiago unties a chicken and gives it to Mike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold it tight, like this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He shows him how to hold it. Mike grabs it and holds it between his arms, smiling, oblivious to what will happen. Santiago grabs the chicken by the head and pulls it off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The chicken starts to shake, spurting blood everywhere. Mike, stunned, lets the animal fall to the ground and the chicken starts its mad race.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Mexican kids start screaming excitedly, chasing the headless chicken. Nobody notices that Debbie and Mike, completely shocked, are about to cry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They arrive at the bride's house. A car adorned with ribb is parked outside. There is no one to be seen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luis honks the horn.   Nobody shows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to see if they're inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Amelia gets out, Patricia's mother appears, upset.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the matter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patricia's not feeling well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Santiago and the other kids are plucking the chicken's feathers. Mike and Debbie stare, horrified.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (In Spanish) Aren't you going to help?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike and Debbie shake their heads.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not good to kill animals.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Santiago smiles to himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (In English) Have you ever been to Kentucky Fried Chicken?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They both nod.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? Did you think that Colonel Sanders kept them as pets?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hands Mike a headless chicken, and he slowly starts to pluck it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patricia, in her bridal dress and clearly six months preg is sitting on her bed with her hands around her belly, wi her mother, father and entire family around her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Both in Spanish) My belly's been hard since the morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That happens when you're nervous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: D'you think the baby's coming?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's no way the baby's coming; she's only six months pregnant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But my belly feels hard, really hard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: D'you want to get married?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, let's go then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what if the baby comes out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, we'll have the wedding and baptize the kid while we're at it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bearded man (50) on an old bicycle rides down the hamle narrow streets. He is carrying a briefcase on the bike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is escorted by dozens of children.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Susan is lying on the floor, moaning softly. Flies hover around the pool of blood under her neck. Richard, worried strokes her hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The grandmother brings them a pot of tea with two cups an sets them on the floor beside them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The grandmother goes to sit in a chair. Mohammed walks in and whispers something to him. Anwar turns to Richard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The doctor's here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The doctor walks across the patio, through the tumult of children and before the scrutiny of two police officers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The doctor enters the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (In Arabic) Allah be with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (In Arabic) Allah be with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richard just bows his head slightly. The doctor walks ove to Susan, shoos the flies away and examines the wound. Sh looks at him, anxious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (In Arabic) The bullet didn't hit her spine or split her jugular. But it did shatter her clavicle and she could bleed to death.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anwar looks worried.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did he say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He says she will be fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop lying to me god damn it, and tell me what the fuck he said!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The doctor addresses Richard in terrible English.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hospital... need hospital...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, we know that. What can you do in the meantime?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (In Arabic, to Anwar) Tell him I have to stitch up the wound to stop the bleeding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anwar draws close to Richard and whispers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He has to sew up her wounds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Susan turns to look at them, suspicious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did he say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richard gets nervous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You need some stitches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean stitches?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The doctor opens his kit and takes out a rudimentary need and thread. He gets ready to sew. Richard questions him, also in whispers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not going to give her any anesthetic?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The doctor and Anwar exchange a look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (To Richard) No, he doesn't use anesthetic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What kind of doctor is he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anwar answers naively, in a low voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's a veterinarian, but he is good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richard looks at him, surprised and angry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He can't take care of her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richard, he might infect the wound...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richard can't answer as he focuses on what the doctor say

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (In Arabic) Tell him that if I don't stitch up her wound she may bleed to death.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If he doesn't sew up the wound, she may bleed to death.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (In Arabic, to Anwar) And tell him her clavicle is broken. We have to fasten a splint to it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He says she has a broken bone and he has to put a splint on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richard remains pensive for a moment. He looks at Susan, then at the doctor and assents tentatively.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (In Arabic) We're going to have to hold her down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He mimes holding her down with his hands. Richard leans o Susan, who weakly languishes on the rug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honey, this is going to hurt a little.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stares at him. Richard turns to Anwar and signals tha he can begin. Anwar holds her hands. Susan, stupefied, to Richard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richard, don't let him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The doctor lifts Susan's neck and starts to stitch.    Sh howls in pain and tries to move away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anwar and Richard hold Susan down.    The doctor sticks t needle in again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Susan shakes her head from side to side trying to pull aw

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't let him, don't let him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calm down... calm down... Susan, they have to sew you up... relax...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richard holds her head to keep her still. She resists.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no...no..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honey, please try to relax...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The doctor rubs alcohol on the wound and starts to stitch She moans in pain. Richard puts a rag in her mouth, on wh she bites down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mohammed sits outside with three friends drinking coffee. From where they are we see the bus and the American touri A battery powered radio plays Moroccan music and commerci in the background.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't understand why Anwar brought them here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well he spends all his time with them, what do you expect.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The woman is hurt, he had to help her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah?   And when have they helped us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I liked one of those tourists.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really?   They're all skin and bones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly Mohammed focuses on the radio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shh... sh... listen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The friends are quiet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Today, near Tazarine, there was an incident where an American was shot...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of the friends interrupts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey look, it's the story.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They said Tazarine, did you hear? We were on the radio...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shh, shut up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Although authorities say it could have been a foiled robbery, the American government claims they are certain it was a terrorist attack. Minister Hassef Hazal has said that in our country, terrorist cells have been eradicated, that Morocco is a peaceful country and that one act of vulgar banditry followed by superficial evaluations such as the U.S. intends to place upon it cannot ruin the image, the economy and the pacifist reputation of our country. American Ambassador Ken Jones, however, insists that it was a terrorist attack on American citizens, that it merits a full investigation, and that the guilty should be punished. So far, the attack has not been attributed to any known terrorist organizations...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mohammed shouts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I fucking told Anwar, I told him he was only going to get us in trouble... he never comes and when he does he always brings trouble...god damn it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are the Americans going to invade our country?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Susan lies on the floor with her neck shoddily stitched a a splint on her shoulder made out of a few sticks and som dirty bandages. She moans in pain and mumbles curses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hate you... I hate you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She tries to stand, but the doctor impedes it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (To Anwar in Arabic) Tell her not to move; the bullet's still inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (To Susan) Don't move, miss. The bullet is still inside you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't give a shit...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My love, don't move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to call the kids.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't move, calm down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to talk to them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't; there's only one phone in town. I'll call them later.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She seems obsessed by the idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to talk to them...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She tries to stand again. As they struggle, the grandmoth takes out a hash pipe form a drawer and lights it. She gi it two drags and squats next to Susan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She shows her how to smoke it and hands it over. The old woman's serenity is such that Susan acquiesces. She takes four drags and slowly starts to relax.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Susan smokes another three times, relaxes and closes her eyes. The old woman goes to get the clump of mud and star to spread it on Susan's neck. Susan does not protest. Richard watches the scene in awe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bus is still parked outside Anwar's house. Some of th passengers sit leaning against the wall, scrutinized by s of the town's children and women who have offered them te and dates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The driver sits in the driver's seat and stares out at th desolate landscape through the windshield.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Several of the tourists nap in their seats. One of them, French tourist, Robert (70), starts to breathe with difficulty. Jane (65), his wife, is alarmed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (In French) Are you ok?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robert nods, but it is clear that he is not.    Jane shou the driver.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (In French) Could you please turn on the air conditioning?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The driver shakes his head regretfully.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (In broken French) No air condition, no gasoline near. I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robert inhales, he can barely breathe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (In French) My husband is feeling ill.     You have to turn it on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (In French) No possible. No gasoline near.      I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (In French) Please, it's too hot.   We can get dehydrated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (In French) I'm really sorry, forgive me, but gasoline finish with air conditioner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom turns to Jane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is he saying?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That he can't turn on the air conditioning, that it's not possible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom stands up and goes to yell at the driver.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck you.   We're gettin' out of here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom resolutely walks up the stairs followed by James.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richard is looking out the window while Susan, relaxed, sleeps. Tom and James walk in making noise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've gotta talk to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richard, with his index finger, signals for him to shut u and points at Susan. He gestures for them to leave the ro

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom, James and others are gathered by the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're leaving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't leave us like this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are old people here and the heat is getting to them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At least wait until an ambulance comes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One man almost fainted in the bus and there's a woman who needs to get back in time to take her medication.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richard turns to Anwar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is there anyone around here who can take them in?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not about that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, we can't wait anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter an English man, one of the older men,    defends h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can't leave him here alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well let him come, then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His wife is in no condition to ride a bus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And lots of other people aren't in any condition to keep waiting, can't you see?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just wait, the ambulance should be here any minute now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're giving you an hour... one hour...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richard breathes, relieved.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chieko walks down the street with Mitsu. They are good- looking and attract attention. They know this and look ba out of the corners of their eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They arrive at a park with a playground: swings, see-saws slides. Several of their deaf-mute volleyball friends are there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With them are two young men with hair dyed blond. One of them, Takeshi (18), has an earring, and the other, Haruki (19), has several tattoos.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mitsu and Chieko greet them in sign language.    Chieko a the slightly chubby Kumiko who they are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're my cousins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chieko turns to look at them, curious. Haruki, the guy wi tattoos, exchanges a look with her. Chieko suddenly feels intimidated and looks down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is he deaf-mute like us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, but he understands some.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Haruki seems to understand what they're saying and leans to whisper something to Takeshi, his brother. They both laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Haruki approaches Chieko and talks to her face to face so she can read his lips.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's your name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chieko and her friend smile.    Chieko takes out her note and pen and writes her name.    Haruki reads it out loud.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chieko?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chieko nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My name's Haruki.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chieko nods, trying to show she's understood. Haruki take out a flask and holds it out to her. Chieko opens it and smells it. Haruki stands in front of her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's whisky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chieko smiles and gives a long swig.       Mitsu asks for and also gives it a long drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do the cops come around here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Gutturally) Sometimes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Haruki takes out some ecstasy and gives it to them. Mitsu and Chieko look at each other and down the pills with a g of whisky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Half-drunk and rushing from the pills, Chieko, her friend and Haruki and Takeshi, play on the swings and see-saw. They laugh at almost anything. Haruki and Chieko are on t see-saw and every time Chieko rises, Haruki looks at her bush. Chieko knows this sometimes opens her legs even mor so he can look to his heart's content. Hormones float in the air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mitsu also takes advantage of the occasion. She flirts wi Haruki whenever she can. Haruki looks happy to be the obj of their attention.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Takeshi, who has started to make out with one of Chieko's friends, turns to the group and speaks slowly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why- don't- we- go- to- Montana?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Night begins to fall. Haruki sits between Mitsu and Chiek He strokes Chieko's knee with his hand; she seems turned

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The taxi parks outside the Montana. Chieko, Mitsu and Har get out of the car and meet with the others at the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They enter. The music, the light, the crowd, it is almost hallucinatory. For Chieko, it is a silent concert of move and chaos.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She and her friends push their way through the place. Har grabs Chieko by the hand, pulls her toward the floor and starts dancing. Chieko looks at the other dancers' rhythm and follows. She slowly manages to follow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The other deaf-mutes also dance. Some do better than othe lost in the sea of lights and people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For Chieko, the dance turns into something hypnotic. She dances with her eyes closed, concentrated on her own rhyt

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When she opens her eyes, she sees that Mitsu, a little dr is grinding against Haruki, feeling him up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chieko seems annoyed by this and goes to defend her terri She starts dancing next to Haruki, but she is constantly interrupted by the surrounding crowd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The struggle between Chieko and Mitsu is a little bit ridiculous. It is finally resolved when Mitsu takes Haruk by the face and starts to kiss him. Chieko doesn't know w to do. Mitsu and Haruki start to make out intensely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly Chieko is left standing in the middle of the clu motionless, while her friends dance awkwardly and Mitsu a Haruki are having the time of their lives. Chieko, defeat by her friend, decides to leave. Mitsu spots her out of t corner of her eye and waves goodbye. Chieko smiles back a walks away from her friends as they dance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chieko enters her building and goes straight to the doorm

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good evening, how may I help you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chieko takes out a piece of paper and a pen from her purs and writes a note. She gives it to the doorman together with Kenji's card. He reads it carefully, and when he's done he turns to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very well miss, I'll call him now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The doorman picks up a cordless phone and dials.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lieutenant Kenji Mamiya, please?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a pause. The doorman gestures to Chieko that the lieutenant will answer in a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lieutenant? Yes, look, I'm with the deaf-mute girl you saw in the afternoon, and she asked me to call you... Yes, her... She says she needs to talk to you, alone... about her father... If it's possible, in her apartment, tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chieko watches attentively.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yussef and Ahmed are sitting against the wall of the hous Yussef's lip is split. Ahmed's nose is bleeding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abdullah paces desperately, while his wife and daughters watch the scene, silent. Abdullah stops to look at Yussef

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why did you do this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They don't answer.   Abdullah leans over and slaps Ahmed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Answer me, god damn it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ahmed won't answer and he turns to Yussef again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We were testing the rifle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abdullah turns and gives Yussef a powerful slap, which he endures with silent dignity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you idiots? You killed a woman, (He turns to Zora) And you, you got naked so your brother would see you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, she got naked lots of times.    I saw how Yussef spied on her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not true.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abdullah turns to Yussef.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it true or not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yussef is silent. Abdullah walks two steps forward and sl Zora. He looks furious, scared, indignant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why did you do this to us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He can barely hold in his tears. Zora brings her hand to her face tearily. Abdullah turns to Ahmed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's the rifle?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A cop interrogates Hassan. His face is badly bruised and his hands are cuffed behind his back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What organization gave you the weapon?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've told you it wasn't an organization; I got it from a hunter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What hunter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Japanese hunter gave it to me many years ago. I've got a picture inside. She can get it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns to look at his wife. She has also been beaten an is guarded by two cops. The interrogating cop authorizes her. She walks in and comes out with a photograph of Hass with Yasujiro, posing with the scimitar-horned oryx. He h it over and the cop examines it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's holding the rifle he gave me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yussef and Ahmed dig up the rifle and the bullets in fron of their parents and sisters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abdullah grabs the rifle, dusts it off and puts the bulle in his bag. He turns to Yasira.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're going to hide out at Naguib's house. If the cops come, tell them we went south.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With the rifle in hand, Abdullah runs off, followed by Yu and Ahmed. The women watch them get lost on the horizon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alarid's truck parks in front of Hassan's house again. Ha is still cuffed and being interrogated. Furious, Alarid g out of the truck and goes toward him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This Abdullah doesn't live where you said he did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He walks over to kick him. The wife intervenes from where she is, some ten yards away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They live where he said they do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alarid turns to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're going to take us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With a gesture, he orders his subordinates to put her in truck. She obeys, docile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And if they're not there, I'll cut your tongue out and I'll kill your husband.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Moroccan police trucks drive down the dusty roads. landscape is harsh and barren.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hassan's wife gives directions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Make a right here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alarid, with his hand, signals the driver to follow her directions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, in the distance, over the hills, she signals th tiny dots running up a slope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (To the driver) Stop...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The trucks stop and Alarid takes out his binoculars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the distance, we can still see Abdullah, Yussef and Ah run across the hills. Abdullah is clearly carrying the ri

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alarid quickly gets out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There they are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All the cops get out with their high powered rifles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abdullah and his sons run full speed.   Yussef sees the t in the distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The police, the police...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They run up a hill to try to lose them, but shots start t ring out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're shooting at us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abdullah stands before his sons and lifts up the rifle as sign of surrender. The shots cease for a few seconds, but they suddenly start again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get down.   Run.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The three shepherds run, huddling as low as they can. Mor shots. They desperately climb between the rocks. Bullets whiz past everywhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abdullah makes one last attempt at surrender. He lifts up the rifle again, sets it on the ground and backs away. Bu the gesture is in vain, as the bullets still rush past.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They begin to run again when Ahmed is hit in one of his calves. He collapses and rolls downhill. Abdullah hurries to rescue him and drags him behind a rock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ahmed won't stop screaming from the pain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They shot me, they shot me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yussef dives on his belly and snakes his way through the rocks. He gets the rifle, loads it and aims at the trucks

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He shoots without hitting anything.    Abdullah turns to

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't shoot, don't shoot!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yussef doesn't pay attention.    He loads again and aims.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yussef aims carefully. He picks out one of the cops who h been shooting barely protected by one of the trucks' fend Yussef shoots and the policeman collapses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The religious ceremony has ended and everyone throws rice the bride and groom. Debbie and Mike enjoy doing it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Several cowboys, among them Santiago, have gone to their trucks and are loudly honking their horns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Music begins to blare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The band plays various NorteГ±o songs. Everyone waits for the music to start. After a while a couple starts to timi dance. Then another, and another, until the dance floor becomes a sway of heads moving to the same rhythm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amelia dances with Mike and Debbie with Santiago; both Am and Santiago show them a few steps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (To Debbie, in Spanish) Like this, look...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He kicks his heel back, then forward. Debbie watches, entertained. Jacinto (55), overweight and with a good-nat face, moves closer to Amelia and watches her dance for a while, she notices and stops, embarrassed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Both in Spanish) Amelia, will you let me dance with you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amelia remains unperturbed, without answering him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been asking you for a dance for 30 years. Does it really cost you that much?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amelia stares at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think your wife would have liked that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon Amelia, she's been dead for 10 years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amelia looks around and then turns to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, just one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacinto chivalrously takes her by the waist and they begi to dance. Santiago watches them, amused, and continues to dance with Mike and Debbie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacinto draws Amelia closer and they kiss gently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beer starts to flow and some of the guests get overbearin There is a small scuffle at the edge of the dance floor, order is soon restored.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guitarist in the band stops the music.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (All in Spanish) Now, Luis and Patricia, come forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone makes way for the bride and groom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We-want-cake, we-want-cake...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The audience and the band sing the little cake song. A gi tacky wedding cake, covered in cream, arrives. The bride grabs the knife and gets ready to cut it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take- a- bite, take- a- bite...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bride gives into the ritual. She tries to take a bite out of the cake without using her hands and someone pushe her face into the cream. Debbie and Mike laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A cowboy pulls out a gun and, festively, fires.   Debbie frightened and goes to hide behind Amelia.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry, it's ok.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The man puts the gun away and walks back onto the dance f as if nothing had happened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luis asks the band to stop the music for a little bit and takes the microphone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good evening everyone... Hey... I want to say something. Love came today, it came here all pretty... (he taps his heart) It's kind of like a little mouse is crawling inside of me. Because that's what love is, it's like your insides get all twisted into knots... and that, baby, is what you've taught me. And because you've shown me, I want to tell everyone that hopefully love will get inside them too...because it feels so good, really...Thanks a lot and keep havin' a good time...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everybody applauds and Luis steps down from the dais, pro of his speech. He goes to Amelia and gives her a very lon and loving hug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Night has fallen. The music plays full blast. Everyone dances, people start to make out, the drunk collapse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patricia breathes regularly with her hands on her belly. Luis drinks beer beside her while he watches the guests d Debbie falls asleep on Amelia's lap while Mike watches th party, overwhelmed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When are my parents getting back?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The question catches Amelia off guard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pronto...muy pronto...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They told me they were coming back today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Se quedaron mГЎs rato.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The answer seem to makes Mike anxious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My dad's coming back with my mom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Yes he is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want him to leave again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He won't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He starts crying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I miss Pat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amelia embraces him and kisses his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yo tambiГ©n hijito, yo tambiГ©n.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boy, tired and sleepy, leans his head on Amelia.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Santiago, a little bit drunk, and Amelia, carrying Debbie who has passed out, say goodbye to Luis and Patricia. Sle Mike leans on the hood of the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (All in Spanish) Stay the night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't. I have to take these kids home and it's almost dawn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Santiago's pretty drunk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drunk my ass. I'm fine. I'll go and come back in an hour.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay for another while, the party's just getting started.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wish, but these kids have to go to school.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Santiago opens the door for Amelia, who carefully sets De on the back seat. Mike gets in and as soon as he does he nestles in to go to sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See you soon, son.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luis and Amelia hug each other.    Then Amelia hugs her d in-law.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Congratulations, dear. (She points at her belly) Take care of my grandson 'cause I'm dying to be a grandmother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She gives her a kiss and gets in the car.   Luis turns to Santiago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sure you're not too drunk?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drunk my ass. I'm fine.     I'll be back soon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Santiago stumbles to the driver's side and opens the door

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The night spreads over the highway that cuts across the desert. Santiago's car drives along, illuminating the cac

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Santiago drives the car, nodding off every now and then. the back, Debbie and Mike have surrendered to sleep. Sant jerks the wheel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (In Spanish) Hey... be careful...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Santiago corrects the vehicles trajectory and goes back t his careless driving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Santiago decides to cross through Mesa de Otay. Since it' nighttime, there are very few cars. They drive across the bridge and stop before the immigration officer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The officer walks up to the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your papers...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Santiago and Amelia take out their passports and their Gr cards. The officer compares the documents to their faces again and again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where you comin' from?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (In bad English) From a wedding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The officer looks through the window and sees Debbie and Mike sleeping in the back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are they?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Santiago rushes to answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're her nephews.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amelia freezes at Santiago's answer.    The officer won't looking at the children.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They don't look like you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (bewildered) I'm in charge of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you have their passports?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amelia takes out their American passports and shows them the cop. He looks them over very carefully. Santiago star to get nervous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is there a problem?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The officer turns to look at them suspiciously.    He obv smells the alcohol.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Should there be one?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Santiago shakes his head.    Debbie wakes up and looks at officer sleepily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey there, sweetie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Debbie rubs her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me, is this lady your aunty?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Debbie innocently shakes her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, she's not my aunty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The officer stares at them harshly. He says something incomprehensible over his radio and asks Santiago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you drunk?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me, sir?   No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get out of the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why, officer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm countin' to three...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He brings his hand to his gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nervous, Santiago glances ahead and looks at the border crossing through his rear-view mirror. He puts the car in reverse and accelerates, trying to escape back to Mexico, but he crashes into an arriving car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (In Spanish) What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The immigration officers take out their guns and run to s him. Santiago sees that the road ahead is clear and he dr away full speed, barely swerving around some customs offi who are searching another vehicle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The officer shouts urgently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They've kidnapped some kids...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He starts a police chase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Santiago's car drives full speed down the highway.   He sometimes looks as if he is going to lose control.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Santiago drives madly. Frightened, Amelia holds onto the dashboard. Debbie and Mike start to cry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (In Spanish) See, I told you you shouldn't have brought them. I told you. I told you..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A trailer drives slowly. Santiago decides to drive around it blindly, and almost drives off the other side of the r

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (In Spanish) Santiago, stop acting crazy and stop the car... Santiago, stop...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Santiago ignores her, concentrated on his driving. He loo through the rear-view mirror. There is nobody behind him, only the dark highway. Santiago steps on the gas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amelia tries to comfort the kids.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (In English) Everything's all right sweeties...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The children won't stop crying, terrified by the speed. Through one of his mirrors, Santiago sees two patrol cars following him with their turrets flashing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (In Spanish) Fucking asshole gringo mother-fuckers, here they come...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Santiago accelerates. The car seems to be out of control. The children scream. Amelia tries to stop Santiago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (In Spanish) Stop... Stop...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Santiago reaches a path and heads toward it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car drives quickly down the path, raising up a cloud dust. The patrol cars are no longer visible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car drives on for a mile and then stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Santiago turns to Amelia.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Their entire dialogue in Spanish) Get out...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amelia looks at the dark desert surrounding them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you crazy? Where?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get out. I'll lose these bastards and then I'll come back for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Santiago, calm down...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aunt Amelia, they're going to get us, get out god damn it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amelia gets out and opens the door for the kids.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (In English) Come with me, dears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The kids get out and Amelia holds their hand.   Santiago the doors and drives off in a cloud of dust.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They start to walk through the darkness. Amelia leads the way, avoiding cacti and thorny branches. The go on like this for a long stretch. The children are quiet and scare

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amelia goes toward the highway and realizes the patrol ca have turned into the path. She runs into the desert with the kids. She can barely see with the light of the early dawn. The three frequently trip on thorny plants.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to go home now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Both of them, scared, start to cry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (In English) Don't cry. We're going home now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks back worried at where the patrol cars were; the are approaching quickly. Then she turns to where Santiago ran. The headlights are soon lost on the horizon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amelia holds them by the hand and pulls them as she runs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (In Spanish) Let's go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She leads them further and further away from the path, sn through the brush. The patrol cars come even closer. Amel ducks and hides behind one of the bushes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The children hide with her. The patrol cars tear past her some five hundred yards away, chasing after Santiago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We suddenly hear sirens. Then, the sound of doors slammin and unintelligible voices over a loudspeaker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do not get out of the car...don't get out...wait...stop...stop...don't run...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After a few seconds, we hear distant gunshots, three, fou Amelia listens, frozen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dusk. Susan sleeps and Richard looks at the vast desert through the window. Anwar, sitting on a chair, with a fan clears away the flies hovering around Susan. We can hear call to prayer and Anwar prostrates himself toward Mecca.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richard observes Anwar's prayer and then looks at Susan w moans in her sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richard and Anwar are sitting in silence while Susan lies unconsciously on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: YamilГ© (9), a beautiful girl with large brown eyes, ente carrying a tray with cookies and tea. She greets Richard with a nod and offers him tea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richard takes the tea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The girl gets up to offer tea to Anwar, who takes it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (In Arabic) Thank you, YamilГ©.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: YamilГ© smiles and leaves the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that your daughter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fourth of eight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eight?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anwar affirms, smiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you have kids?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richard takes out his wallet and pulls out a photo of him Susan, Mike and Debbie. He shows it to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anwar takes it and looks at it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just two?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three... (He remains pensive) Yes, just two.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should have more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anwar returns the photo. Richard looks at it for a moment before putting it back into his wallet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about you? How many wives do you have?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Smiling) I can only afford one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And is this where you live?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, this is where my family lives. I live in Marrakesh. But I come whenever I can...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They exchange a look. We hear a car engine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An old, run-down Peugeot driven by a policeman pulls up i front of the house. The policeman gets out. The tourists, leaning on the wall, get up to see what's happening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mohammed comes out to talk to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Arabic) What happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (In Arabic) I need to talk to the American.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom interrogates Mohammed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did he say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No English...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The policeman, Anwar and Richard are chatting in the pati

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (To Anwar) When did he find out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (In Arabic) When did you know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (In Arabic) A while ago... they said the ambulance isn't coming anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A while ago... he says the ambulance broke down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? Tell him to call another one. He has to get another one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (In Arabic, to the Policeman) He wants you to call another ambulance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (In Arabic) You know there isn't another one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (To Richard) There isn't another ambulance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell do you mean there isn't another ambulance? You've got to get her out of here...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He faces the police officer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She can't stay here or she'll die. Call another fucking ambulance...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The policeman cannot understand and remains expressionles

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, move... call another ambulance...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (In Arabic) He asks how we're going to get the woman out of here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (In Arabic) Tell him that they told me that his embassy is going to deal with it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He says your embassy will deal with the matter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richard now shouts at Anwar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How the fuck are they going to deal with it? It's your shitty fucking country's responsibility.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (In Arabic) The Americans want to send one of their helicopters but I think there are some problems.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anwar mulls over his answer.   He seems to want to lie ag

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're going to try to send a helicopter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (incredulous) A helicopter?... Let's get out of here...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He starts walking. Anwar catches up to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richard turns to him, desperate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need to make a phone call.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They turn towards the exit leaving the cop behind, who do seem to understand. Tom and James take advantage of the situation to go talk to Richard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can't stay here any longer. It's going to get dark soon. Lots of people aren't feeling well and its dangerous to stay here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richard explodes and pushes Tom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop fucking with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you dare push me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh no?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pushes him again, angrily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing, you stupid fuck?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leave asshole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom shoves him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richard becomes furious and loses it, hitting him over an over again. Some of the tourists get involved. James mana to grab him with Anwar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, take it easy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm fed up with that asshole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James pulls him away while other tourists pull Tom away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Try to calm down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calm down? My wife is dying up there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come with us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where the fuck do you want me to take her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Try to understand, many of them can't go on. Tell me, honestly, is there any point in us staying?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richard threatens him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You leave and I'll kill you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James is going to say something, but Richard turns around and walks away as he is about to say something. Anwar fol

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richard is in the phone booth with telephone in hand. A woman's voice answers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello...
