dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel... What's going on? Nobody's come... Who have you talked to... we need help...she's dying...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What d'you mean dying?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's very weak, please, you've got to do something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark, your business partner, already called someone in the Secretary of State, they're going to help you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't just make these stupid fucking calls, you've got to do something...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richard calm down, we're doing everything we can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How the fuck do you expect me to calm down? Susan is dying...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm flying over there tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's no time. I need to get Susan out of here now! Put Mark on the phone...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know if I can find him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God damn it, connect the fucking call.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A few seconds go by. Desperate, Richard looks at the town it goes about its daily business, oblivious to his traged

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richard, it's Mark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark, help me... Susan is dying and there are no ambulances, there's no hospital, there's nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richard, the news is all over the place. They're going to go help you, soon, but there have been some political problems that are being resolved.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't give a shit about political problems... Do something, now, please...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through the window, Richard, astonished, watches the bus drive away, kicking up dust as it disappears in the dista

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Son of a bitch...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He throws the phone away and runs after the bus. We hear Mark's desperate voice over the receiver.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richard... what happened? Richard, answer me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richard runs after the bus as it drives away down the sid streets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop... Stop... Stop you mother- fuckers stop...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bus vanishes into the distance. Richard picks up a st and hurls it impotently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chieko is in her room, sitting on her bed, staring into s The doorbell light goes on. She remains motionless for a few moments. The light goes on again. Chieko breathes in and goes to open the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chieko opens the door and runs into Kenji, who greets her if she were just anybody.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She bows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They told me you wanted to talk to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chieko, who has been unable to read his lips, asks him wi her hands that he speak slowly and face her. Kenji is embarrassed by his tactlessness and tries to be more considerate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. Is there something you wanted to tell me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chieko nods and asks him in with her hand. Kenji takes of his shoes and leaves them at the door. Chieko leads him t the living room and with a gesture asks if he wants anyth to drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you have tea?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chieko nods and goes into the kitchen. Kenji glances over the apartment. Chieko comes back from the kitchen holding strange gadget which she puts on the living room table. A small bulb lights. Kenji just watches her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chieko gestures for him to sit down.     Kenji and Chieko across from each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chieko takes out her notebook and pen, writes something d and hands it over to Kenji. Kenji reads, seems surprised and reads again slowly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "My father had nothing to do with my mother's death," what's this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chieko is disconcerted at the question. She takes her notebook and starts writing. Kenji reads and turns to her

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your father was asleep when she jumped off the balcony?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She nods. She gets up, asks Kenji to go with her and walk toward the balcony.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She opens the door to the balcony and points at the void: it's over twelve floors. Kenji looks over; the distance i dizzying. Chieko writes in her notebook and shows him the piece of paper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You saw her jump?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She nods and writes again.    She looks perturbed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've already told the other officers?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She nods again.   Kenji holds her by her arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know what you're talking about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chieko remains motionless for a few seconds. She scrawls her notebook "Then why do you want to talk to my father?" Kenji reads and then turns to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's about a hunting rifle in his name.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The red bulb on the gadget starts to blink. Chieko spots from the balcony and signals to Kenji that she has to go the kitchen. She runs off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kenji stands and looks at the photographs of Yasujiro hun all over the world: with a kudu in Africa, a black bear i Kamchatka, Hassan and the Oryx in Morocco.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chieko comes back with a cup of steaming tea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does your father still hunt?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She shakes her head.   She writes something and hands it

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There was an incident with a rifle in your father's name. That's why we want to talk to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The news weighs on Chieko; she looks away. The sounds of Tokyo come in through the living room: its car horns, its voices.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly a rush of wind comes in. Chieko sees the balcony doors are open and goes to close them. She then comes bac to the living room and sits down, dejected.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kenji sits down beside her and leaves the tea on the tabl He doesn't know what to do and looks uncomfortable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She picks up the notebook and writes.    Kenji reads.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, your father isn't going to jail. We just need to talk to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a long silence. Chieko seems immersed in a remot inaccessible world. Kenji turns his face to hers so that she can read his lips.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to go now. Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chieko grabs his arm and shakes her head, urging him to s They exchange a look for an instant and Kenji insists.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gets up to leave. Chieko signals for him to wait for a moment and goes to her room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kenji stands in the middle of the room, waiting.    Chiek comes back completely naked. Her skin bristles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She walks toward him, breathing through her mouth. Kenji disconcerted when he sees the quiet teenager approach. Sh walks all the way up to Kenji and when she is about to ta another step, he holds her back with both hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She doesn't pay attention, breaks free and stands a few i away from him. She is almost panting. She holds out her hand and caresses Kenji's ear. He stands there, immobile, without taking his eyes off Chieko's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She takes his hand and puts it on one of her breasts. Ken strokes her breast and then pulls his hand away. She grab it again and puts it back on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no, no... this is wrong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kenji looks turned on and confused: Chieko is beautiful, he knows he cannot go on and takes his hand away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I can't.     You're just a girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She walks up to his face and licks it.    He is confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enough, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He grabs her by her arms and moves her away. She grabs th sleeve of his jacket and pulls him back. She hugs him and suddenly Chieko starts crying, disconsolate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kenji, bewildered, first does nothing, but upon seeing Chieko's despair, holds her. She buries her face in his shoulder. Her nakedness becomes increasingly fragile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abdullah, afraid, watches his son shoot. The police have stopped firing and run for cover. Yussef loads the rifle again and aims carefully. He shoots and, in the distance, we can see one of the headlights on a police truck shatte

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abdullah shouts at Yussef desperately.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yussef, stop shooting!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Furious, Yussef loads the rifle again and starts shooting the cops. Ahmed won't stop screaming from the pain. Confu Abdullah doesn't know if he should console his wounded so or stop the enraged Yussef.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the distance, the cops reorganize.    We hear the fara shots of Alarid giving orders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Move that truck... god damn it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of the cops gets onto a truck and uses it as a parape Yussef aims again, but this time the policemen are well covered. Abdullah drags himself all the way to Yussef.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me that rifle...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yussef turns to his father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're going to kill us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me that rifle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He tries to wrest it away, but Yussef resists. The strugg and Abdullah finally pulls it away. When Yussef tries to snatch it back, the police fire a round of shots and the barely have time to hide.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The air is thick with gunshots. Yussef and Abdullah, terrified, stick to the stones. The bullets strike very close to them, and they can't even raise their heads.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ahmed won't stop complaining.    Abdullah shouts at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ahmed, don't move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The gunshots rain down for over a minute. When they stop, Abdullah turns to look at Ahmed, who is lying motionless the rocks with bullet in his back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ahmed!   Ahmed!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oblivious of the police, he gets up and runs toward him. Motionless, Ahmed just moans. With every breath, his shir grows bloodier.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ahmed!   Ahmed!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He rolls Ahmed over and lays his head on his lap. Abdulla cannot stop crying. Yussef, ducking, runs toward his brot Abdullah laments nervously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't die, don't die.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yussef is shocked upon seeing his dead brother. He stands up and, without caring whether anyone fires at him or not he raises the rifle up in the air for the police to see t he is not aiming, and starts to break it against the rock

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When he's finished breaking it he opens his arms and walk toward the police. One of them policemen looks at him thr a pair of binoculars. Alarid interrogates him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's happening?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A boy is walking this way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is he armed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The officer takes a careful look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It doesn't look like it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are the others doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The officer watches Abdullah carrying his wounded son.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A man is holding somebody injured.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is the other one still walking this way?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alarid turns to the other officers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aim.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The police aim and hold Yussef in their sights. He keeps walking resolutely toward his aggressors. He is crying softly, keeping his arms open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yussef walks until his is 10 meters away from the police he kneels with his arms open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I killed the American, I was the only one who shot at you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cautious, the police still aim at his chest. Yussef proce with his confession, babbling it through his nerves, his pain and his attempt to control his sobbing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They did nothing... nothing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns to his father and his brother and points at them

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kill me, but save my brother, he did nothing... nothing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alarid moves in, aiming at him with a rifle.    Behind hi five other cops, also ready to shoot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the ground...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yussef does not obey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Save my brother...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the ground...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yussef turns his face toward Alarid looks him in the eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Save my brother... please...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He lies on the floor, crying. Alarid puts his gun down an looks at him: his enemy is a disconsolate child. Then he looks up at Abdullah who is screaming his lamentations. H turns to one of his subordinates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go help them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of the officers goes to help Abdullah and Ahmed. lies on the floor, crying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun rises.   Amelia and the children keep walking. sweat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't walk anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have to keep walking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why is the air so hot?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amelia stops and tries to distract them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (the entire dialogue in English) Because coyotes and snakes and quails have already breathed that air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike remains pensive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're breathing the same air animals breathe?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And it doesn't rot?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it doesn't rot.   We all breathe this air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dawn. The three walk through the desert.      Debbie walk mechanically, tired and exhausted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't anymore. I'm thirsty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So am I.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amelia looks around her: no sign of civilization.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (In Spanish) Just a little further and we'll go look for water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amelia lumbers heavily, carrying Debbie asleep on her arm Mike drags his feet a few yards behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They walk for a long stretch through the thorny brush unt they reach a small mound where a leafy mesquite grows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amelia lays a limp Debbie down on the ground and sits on mound of earth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (In Spanish) We're going to rest here for a while.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if there are snakes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, there aren't any.   Come, lie down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boy, exhausted and docile, obeys and lies on her ches Amelia leans against the trunk with Debbie on her legs. T children sleep while Amelia, nodding off, tries to keep w

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is well into the morning. Amelia and the children slee deeply. There is a noise and Amelia opens her eyes. She sees a border patrol truck driving around near them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looking through the branches, she spies on the truck and watches another one join it. Mike awakes and sits up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happening?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amelia ducks and lays Mike face down.    The two trucks s approach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (To Mike, in a low voice, in Spanish) Stay still.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A truck drives by about eighty yards away and then passes The other one cuts diagonally across its path and then ge lost in the desert.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amelia gets up and shakes off the dust. She looks out of place, wearing her best clothes torn by the bramble. She makes sure the trucks are leaving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are we hiding if we didn't do anything wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (In English) Because they think we did something wrong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not true: you're bad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amelia freezes upon hearing the boy's words.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, sweetie, I'm not bad.     I just did something stupid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She pulls him toward her and hugs him tenderly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (In Spanish) I love you very much, sweetie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amelia turns and tries to wake Debbie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (In English) Debbie, we've got to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The girl opens her eyes, but doesn't answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Debbie, sweetheart, wake up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She closes her eyes again. Amelia notices her lips are dr and her breath is irregular: she is visibly dehydrated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Upon seeing that she doesn't react, Amelia looks for the trucks: they're far away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amelia carries Debbie in her arms under the burning sun, following a cattle trail. Mike walk behind, pale, sweaty. Amelia looks to the horizon: there is no sign of the truc

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are still walking. Amelia can barely go on. She stop to rest. She is sweating copiously. Mike also looks weak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The heat is strong and Amelia is beaten. She looks for th shade of a cluster of mesquites and lays Debbie down. The she turns to Mike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sweetie, I'm going to go look for help. Stay here and don't move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not staying here alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honey, you have to take care of Debbie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike looks at her with imploring eyes.   Amelia caresses

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I won't be long. I promise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amelia desperately looks through the desert.   She also l dehydrated. She drifts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amelia drags her feet as she walks.   She can go no furth

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amelia sees a small hillock and climbs it with difficulty She surveys the environs from the top. In the distance sh sees a Border Patrol truck driving down a path.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With great effort, Amelia runs down the hill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (In Spanish) Stop, stop...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The truck doesn't stop. Amelia keeps running, flailing he arms and screaming wildly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir... sir... stop...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The truck stops and backs up.   Amelia keeps going, tripp over stones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John (29), a thoroughly Mexican officer, gets out and she runs up, panting, to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please help me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John stares at her suspiciously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to go get two kids I left behind in the desert.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John looks at her suspiciously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (In Spanish, with a terrible accent) Are they illegal immigrants?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, they're American.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When did you cross?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (In English) I didn't cross, I live here.   Please, help me find these kids.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John keeps staring at her.   He points to a mesquite.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stand there and don't move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amelia obeys. John goes back to the vehicle, opens the do and sits down and grabs the radio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Attention base, I have a 4533...I have the suspect.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amelia doesn't manage to hear what the radio says. She lo attentively at what the agent is doing. John stops and ru back to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're under arrest. Turn around and put your hands behind your head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amelia despairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I left those kids in the desert, I swear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John pushes her forcefully against the truck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Turn around, now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns around with her hands over her head.    John ha her and leads her to the vehicle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amelia, cuffed, and John, drive down a path in the desert

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which way are they?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amelia studies the terrain.    She points at some mesquit the distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (In Spanish) Over there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The truck parks and they both get out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are they?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amelia explores the landscape, anguished.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They must be around here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another border patrol truck arrives and pulls up next to them. Eliseo (34), looks out the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This lady said they were here, but there's nobody.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (In Spanish) Ma'am, you're not lying to us, are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (In Spanish) I swear they're around here somewhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She sees another cluster of mesquites and points toward t

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They must be over that way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They arrive at the cluster. The two trucks park and the three get out. She is still cuffed. A helicopter hovers above them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They walk around: nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's nobody here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (To Eliseo, in Spanish) I left them about a kilometer in from the road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (In Spanish) Which road?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She doesn't know what to say.    John grabs her by the ar drags her toward the vehicle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't believe you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amelia looks at him desperately.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (In English) I swear they're around here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John is not affected.   He keeps pulling her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (In English) John, wait, maybe she's telling the truth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe she's not, let's go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please sir, believe me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John pays no attention.   She turns to Eliseo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (In Spanish) I swear, they're lost, they're going to die. I have to find them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John keeps pulling her. He puts her in the truck and clos the door before Eliseo's passive gaze.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (In English) Please no... please...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Night begins to fall. From the window we can hear the noi of the town: voices, goats bleating, camels moaning, musi from a radio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Susan wakes from her slumber and turns to Richard, who is leaning on a wall, tired, sweaty, with his eyes closed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you need?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richard... if I die, take care of the kids. Especially Mike, he really needs you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not going to die. You can't die. You just can't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't ever leave them again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I'm not going to leave them and don't you even think about leaving me, because I'll kill you like nobody's killed you before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She smiles.   He caresses her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I peed my pants.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I couldn't hold it in and I peed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richard touches between her legs and feels the moisture.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to tell Mike on you, so you never scold him again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They both laugh.   She grimaces in pain when she does.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need to pee again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (To Anwar) Do you have a pot I can borrow?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anwar looks in a corner and hands it over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (To Anwar) Can you leave us alone for a moment?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The grandmother and Anwar exit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come, try it like this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He lifts up her dress, pulls down her underpants and sets the basin under her. She puts her arm around him to pull herself up, but can't move her right arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They laugh.   He kisses her.   We start to hear the strea

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now I can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: While she pees, they kiss painfully.    She starts to cry

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forgive me my love. When Pat died I didn't know what to do, the pain drove me crazy... I was scared, that's why I left... forgive me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was scared too... when I saw Pat lying still in his crib...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her voice breaks up and she can barely go on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It wasn't my fault, it wasn't... I couldn't do anything for him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it wasn't your fault. I was wrong...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He strokes her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shhh... it wasn't your fault my love, it wasn't anybody's fault... Pat just left... (A beat) Forgive me, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forgive me for not forgiving you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richard hugs her and starts to laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You missed; you got my leg.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They both laugh, and as they do, the blanket covering Sus wound slips off. Richard sees her swollen, bruised arm. H touches it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does it hurt?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So much... so much...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richard looks worried and leaves the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He walks out onto the stairs and calls Anwar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anwar...Anwar...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anwar runs into the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've got to get her out of here. Where's the clinic?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In Alnif, an hour and a half away from here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you get us a car we can take her in?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anwar remains pensive for a moment and then nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richard is squatting next to Susan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My love... I'm going to get you out of here.   We're going to try to take you to a clinic an hour and a half away from here. Do you think you can make it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She thinks for a moment and then nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need you to be strong. Really strong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Susan sighs: the effort required seems as if it will be t much, but she nods again. Richard hugs and kisses her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richard and the vet carry Susan out on a wheelbarrow. It very difficult to move her. She is clearly in pain and gr quietly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Outside the house is the policeman with his Peugeot. Anwa is talking to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richard and the vet carry Susan all the way to the car. Richard stands before the policeman he humiliated earlier

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you for lending us the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anwar translates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (In Arabic) He thanks you for lending us the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The policeman nods kindly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dozens of girls and boys and a few adults stare at the sc

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gingerly, Richard, Anwar and the vet lift her into the ca and softly lay her on the back seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Even so, she screams in pain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ahhh... Ahhh...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richard holds her hand and squeezes it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sweetie, you've got to hold on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richard gets into the car, and as they're about to drive off, the shopkeeper runs up to them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (In Arabic) Stop... Stop...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The shopkeeper catches up to them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (In Arabic) They're calling from the American Embassy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richard walks into the cubicle.    The phone is off the h and Richard answers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just a moment, I'm going to put you through to ambassador Ken Clifford.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richard awaits. In the corner of the room, he sees a goat head covered with flies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, Richard Jones?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, speaking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm very sorry about what happened to your wife, but you can be sure that the culprits will be punished.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My wife is dying. She's in urgent need of medical attention.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're working on it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richard interrupts angrily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've been here for five hours. What the fuck are you waiting for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Moroccan government won't let us use their airspace. They refused to acknowledge that this was an act of terrorism...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't wait anymore... I'm taking my wife to a clinic in Tinerhir right now...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay put... we've settled the matter. A helicopter should arrive soon...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can't wait any longer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The helicopter is on its way. Don't move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My wife is in critical condition. How long is the chopper going to take?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Soon... it'll be there soon... Be patient, it won't be long.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amelia sits in a room painted white. An American, his hai slicked back, dressed in a shirt and tie, sits before her

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (In Spanish) Is your full name Amelia Gloria JordГЎn Susilla?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (In Spanish) Yes sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you understand English?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (In English) Yes sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (In English) Ma'am, it was a miracle that we found those kids. I don't know how you could leave them alone in the desert.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had to look for help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your reckless behavior endangered their lives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amelia stops arguing.   She looks worried.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How are they?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's none of your business, ma'am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The man's words hurt Amelia, who looks away to avoid cryi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've committed serious crimes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just took the kids to my son's wedding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No ma'am, you did not just do that. You took them to another country without their parents' permission and you put them in danger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, I raised these kids since they were born. I take care of them day and night. I feed them breakfast, lunch and dinner. I play with them. Mike and Debbie are like my own children.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sternly) But they are not your kids, ma'am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about my nephew, Santiago?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't have any information on him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amelia looks destitute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We located the parents in Morocco. They're very angry, but they've decided not to raise charges.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amelia exhales, relieved.   The policeman leans toward he

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nevertheless, the government of the United States has deemed you were seriously breaking the law and has decided to immediately and definitively deport you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amelia loses her breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been living here for fifteen years. My things are here, I rent a house, I made my life here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should've thought of that beforehand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to talk to a lawyer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you attempt to take this to court, I assure you you will end up in jail. If you want my advice, accept the deportation and never come back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bus parks in front of the border. Several border patrol agents have formed a wall for the illegal immigrants to p directly through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The illegal immigrants get out and walk toward Mexico. Amelia crosses, she keeps looking back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The illegal immigrants cross into Mexico, where they disb into small groups. Amelia walks alone. Before she walks away she turns to one of the other deported Mexicans.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (In Spanish) Do you have a cigarette?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He acquiesces. He rummages through his pant pockets and pulls out a pack of cigarettes. He offers one to Amelia, takes it. He also pulls out some matches and lights one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amelia smokes, drifting. After a while she sits on a side and leans on a post. She looks into the street at the peo passing by and starts crying softly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A dusty and battered pick up truck arrives. Inside are he son and her comadre. Her son steps down and hugs her in silence as she cries. Her comadre observes them from a distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The truck is parked in front of Anwar's house. Richard an Susan wait in the back while the boy, Anwar and the vet l on the hood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly a helicopter with American insignia flies over t and goes to land in an empty lot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anwar looks up and watches the helicopter descend. The helicopter kicks up a cloud of dust before the stunned ga of dozens of children. Some camels are frightened. Some starving dogs bark at it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They carry Susan to the helicopter in a stretcher. They load her in carefully. Richard follows her through the wi generated by the helicopter. Anwar catches up to them to goodbye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good luck, mister...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you for everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richard gives Anwar a hug which he responds to affectiona Richard takes out his wallet and holds out three hundred- dollar bills, which Anwar rejects.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No sir, no... Allah be with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They look each other in the eye and then Richard gets int the chopper. It takes off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The helicopter silently flies over the Moroccan desert.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hospital's perimeter is guarded by dozens of soldiers The security is impressive. A group of doctors and nurses with a stretcher wait in the parking lot. Several journal and cameras observe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ken and his entourage await the helicopter's landing. The helicopter approaches. The cameramen hurry to position themselves for a better shot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A reporter speaks to the camera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In this helicopter is Susan Jones, an American mother of two who was seriously injured in a terrorist attack. It appears fundamentalist organizations planned the attack...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The helicopter settles softly in the parking lot. It is immediately surrounded by several Moroccan soldiers. The doctors on the ground prepare the stretcher.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ken walks hurriedly toward the chopper, guarding himself from the wind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Susan is immediately placed on the stretcher and quickly taken to the emergency room. Richard follows close behind until his is intercepted by Ken.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Jones, I'm Ken Clifford, Ambassador to the United States.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richard keeps running behind the stretcher.   Ken stops h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A first rate medical team is going to tend to her, but if you want we can take her to a hospital in Italy as soon as she's stable...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are lots of reporters waiting. Is there anything you want to say to the press? A statement against terrorism?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richard looks at him as if he doesn't know what he's talk about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The last thing I'm worried about right now is the fucking press.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pulls away from Ken and follows Susan toward the E.R.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Several Moroccan doctors are examining Susan.    Richard observes worriedly from a window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of the doctors comes out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (In good English) We're going to have to operate immediately.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is she going to be ok?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's probable. We're going to try to save her arm.   She's been bleeding internally, and there's been some clotting so there's a high risk of gangrene.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (insistently, as if he hadn't heard the doctor) But she's going to be ok?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Moroccan doctor puts his hand on Richard's shoulder a thinks about his answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, she's going to be ok.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The doctor leaves and Richard goes back to looking at his wife through the glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The doctors are still prepping her.   Richard walks in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stands next to Susan, who is unconscious. He looks at doctor and she moves to one side. Richard leans over and kisses her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He walks away and the nurses start to wheel her to the O.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richard is talking on the phone from an office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amelia?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How is everything?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ok sir, Mrs. Rachel told me. I'm very sorry. How is Mrs. Susan?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're going to operate now... Amelia... take good care of the kids, and don't tell them anything...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No sir, don't worry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put Mike on please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A few seconds pass and Mike answers.   This is the phone from the beginning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi dad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey sweetie, how are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad, guess what? Today, at school, they brought some baby chickens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I held one in my hand. He was really little and he was all warm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richard starts to cry for the first time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad, are you ok?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richard tries to hold back his sobbing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I'm ok. Everything's fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boy keeps talking while Richard cries.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Mariana wanted to take one home, but the teacher didn't let her...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chieko, naked, sits in an armchair, again submerged in th remote world of her silence. Before her, Kenji observes h nakedness, her sadness, her pained beauty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For a while they remain motionless. She seems to return from the long journey to herself and turns to look at him Their eyes meet. There are still tears in Chieko's eyes. They hold each other's gaze until Chieko gets up, gets he notebook, scribbles down some words and gives them to him

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kenji reads them and looks at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't have to apologize for anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She sits down beside him. They look at each other again f a few, long seconds. Chieko takes his hand, strokes it fo moment, kisses it, sucks one of his fingers and then puts back in its place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She grabs her notebook and starts writing a long note. It takes her almost a minute to do so. Kenji, nervous becaus of her proximity, watches her write feverishly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chieko finishes writing, folds the note and hands it to K Kenji starts unfolding it, but Chieko stops him. She take it away from him, folds it again and puts it in his breas pocket. She signals for him to read it later.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kenji gets up to go. She stands next to him. Her nakednes contrasts with Kenji's toughness. He bows his head to say goodbye and she moves aside for him to pass. Kenji walks past her as she watches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kenji reaches the door. He opens it and turns to look at Chieko again, who has been left in the middle of the hall He bows his head again and leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chieko watches him leave and closes her eyes painfully.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kenji rides the elevator down, touched, barely able to co his emotion. The elevator doors open and he walks out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kenji walks past the doorman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He keeps walking. On the other end of the lobby, at the parking lot entrance, Yasujiro walks in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The doorman calls Kenji as he is about to leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Officer... officer...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kenji stops.   Beside him is Yasujiro.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is the man you were looking for.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kenji approaches him while the doorman discretely moves a to leave them alone in the lobby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good evening, I'm lieutenant Mamiya.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good evening, how can I help you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, there was an incident and...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yasujiro looks at him attentively. Kenji, still moved by Chieko, looks distracted, confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't mean to bother you, but... (a beat) Do you own a .270 caliber Winchester 70 rifle with the registration number...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kenji looks through his pockets, takes out a small notebo and looks up the missing number.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't remember the license, but I did have a rifle like the one you described.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it true that you gave it to a Mr. Hassan Ibrahim, who lives in southern Morocco?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hassan Ibrahim?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He says he was your guide in a hunt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hassan? Of course. He was a very good guide and I gave him the rifle. Hassan is a very kind man. Did anything happen?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There was an attempted murder with that rifle, and the Moroccan police want to confirm it's not off the black market.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I gave it to him. (a beat) Is Hassan ok?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yasujiro remains silent for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Am I legally involved?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not for the moment. You may have to go testify for your friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I leave now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They both bow to say goodbye. Yasujiro walks toward the elevator. Kenji calls out to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kenji approaches and Yasujiro awaits, expectant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your daughter told me about your wife on the balcony. I'm very sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What balcony?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About how your wife killed herself by jumping off the balcony.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My wife never jumped off a balcony. She shot herself in the head. My daughter was the first to find her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kenji is left speechless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've explained it to the police several times. Don't bother us with that anymore, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm very sorry sir, we won't bother you anymore. Good night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns around and leaves the building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kenji walks down the streets immersed in his thoughts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kenji sits in a half-empty bar.   He turns to the bartend

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another whisky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The T.V. has been turned on to a Japanese newscast. Kenji takes out Chieko's note, reads it and, as soon as he is d closes his eyes. He looks around. Everybody seems to be immersed in a world far from his own.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A reporter appears on T.V.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Susan Jones, the American woman wounded in an attack in Morocco ten days ago, left the hospital today, heading to the United States...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Susan appears on screen in a wheelchair pushed by a male nurse and followed by Richard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bartender leans over to Kenji.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you want something to eat?    I could make you a sandwich.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When he looks back at the news, the story has changed. drinks his whisky parsimoniously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yasujiro rides the elevator up, lost in thought.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From the balcony, naked, Chieko observes the city stretch before her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yasujiro walks in and encounters his daughter completely naked. There are still traces of Chieko's tears in her ey

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yasujiro is affected when he sees his daughter like this, but says nothing. He slowly walks toward her. Chieko look hurt, but whole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yasujiro stands beside her. They look at each other. Chie holds out her hand and takes his. Chieko squeezes. She lo at the city and then looks at her father's eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He strokes her hair and they both stand on the balcony, w the massive city sprawling under them.
